questions.question: What is the main goal of using queuing models like M/M/1/N?

answers.a: To minimize the average waiting time of customers
answers.b: To maximize the number of customers in the system
answers.c: To reduce the utilization factor of the service provider
answers.d: To increase the variability of the service time distribution

explanations.a: To minimize the average waiting time of customers
explanations.b: To minimize the average waiting time of customers
explanations.c: To minimize the average waiting time of customers
explanations.d: To minimize the average waiting time of customers

questions.question: What happens if the arrival rate exceeds the service rate in an M/M/1/N queuing system?

answers.b: The system becomes unstable and breaks down
answers.d: The queue capacity is exceeded and customers are turned away

explanations.a: The system becomes unstable and breaks down
explanations.b: The system becomes unstable and breaks down
explanations.c: The system becomes unstable and breaks down
explanations.d: The system becomes unstable and breaks down

questions.question: What is the utilization factor in an M/M/1/N queuing model?

answers.a: The ratio of the arrival rate to the service rate
answers.b: The ratio of the service rate to the arrival rate
answers.c: The ratio of the arrival rate to the product of the service rate and the maximum number of customers
answers.d: The ratio of the service rate to the product of the arrival rate and the maximum number of customers

explanations.a: The ratio of the arrival rate to the product of the service rate and the maximum number of customers
explanations.b: The ratio of the arrival rate to the product of the service rate and the maximum number of customers
explanations.c: The ratio of the arrival rate to the product of the service rate and the maximum number of customers
explanations.d: The ratio of the arrival rate to the product of the service rate and the maximum number of customers

questions.question: What is the difference between an M/M/1 queuing system and an M/M/1/N queuing system?

answers.a: M/M/1/N has a finite queue capacity, while M/M/1 does not have a queue capacity
answers.b: M/M/1 has a finite queue capacity, while M/M/1/N does not have a queue capacity
answers.c: M/M/1 has multiple servers, while M/M/1/N has a single server
answers.d: M/M/1/N has multiple servers, while M/M/1 has a single server

explanations.a: The main difference between an M/M/1 queuing system and an M/M/1/N queuing system is that the latter has a finite queue capacity, while the former does not.
